description: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma, FIGO grade I, with superficial myometrial invasion (<1/3) confined to the uterus, negative lymph nodes, no angiolymphatic invasion or extrauterine spread.
patient_notes: You have a low-grade endometrial cancer that was removed by hysterectomy. The cancer was confined to the inner muscle layer of the uterus with no spread to lymph nodes or other organs. Based on these findings, no additional treatment is needed other than regular follow-up visits. We will continue routine monitoring to ensure your health.

verification.assessment: The extraction is accurate except for the pathologic T classification; superficial invasion (<1/3 myometrium) warrants pT1a rather than pT1b.

pathologic_stage.issues: Extracted pT1b does not align with tumor invasion of less than one-third of the myometrium, which corresponds to pT1a under current AJCC/TNM guidelines.

change_explanations.pathologic_stage: Changed from 'pT1b pN0 M0' to 'pT1a pN0 M0'. Reason: Extracted pT1b does not align with tumor invasion of less than one-third of the myometrium, which corresponds to pT1a under current AJCC/TNM guidelines.
